actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution And Civil Justice.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Constitution and Civil Justice

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to prohibit a law increasing the compensation for the services of the Senators and Representatives from taking effect until an election of Representatives has intervened, and to permit a law otherwise varying such compensation to take effect upon enactment.
subjects: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits any law increasing the compensation for the services of the Senators and Representatives from taking effect until an election of Representatives has intervened. Repeals the twenty-seventh amendment to the Constitution.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to prohibit a law increasing the compensation for the services of the Senators and Representatives from taking effect until an election of Representatives has intervened, and to permit a law otherwise varying such compensation to take effect upon enactment.
